samples.question: >> Have you ever learned to play a musical instrument?
samples.transcript: >> Yeah. Actually, I had well, I tried learning piano, but things turned ugly. So, now I am a guitarist myself. I have been learning playing a guitar for 5 years plus, but still I am a beginner because I do not really have too much time to practice it. Yeah.

samples.question: The first question is is it important to have a break during work or study?
samples.transcript: >> Well from my perspective I think having breaks is compulsory because we are we are human. We are not machines and even machines need to have times break time and it needs to be taken care of. So when people work or study for a long time for example like 5 to 6 hours they do need a break like at least an hour break maybe go for lunch take a walk or just play some music so they can relax down and I think if they do not take breaks during those work they will be burnt out and exhausted so it will greatly affect their productivity and maybe have some negative positive outcome. >> Mhm.

samples.question: So, what sports do young people like to do now?
samples.transcript: >> Actually, most of the popular sport are volleyball, basketball, and I think pickle ball, which is just been well known for months. But the problem is kids nowaday, they do not usually do sports that much no more. Yeah. They used to do it a lot because the technology was not developed back then. So as the time changed more technological device went in kids now usually play iPads and online videos like Roblox, Minecraft and etc. So I think we do really need to make a change and push themselves to do more outdoor work activities. Not only to increase their physical health but to let them know what the real world is not the not just inside the screen. >> Mhm.

samples.question: Are there more activities for young people now than 20 years ago?
samples.transcript: >> Okay. So there actually more but things are different. So I think back in the past when I was not even born yet, so people used to have a lot of physical and outdoor activities like running, cycling, and maybe just playing with their neighbors. Nowadays since the modernization, we have a lot of technological device and it really helps but it is a double sword age. Oh, it is a double-edged sword. Sorry. So, it can help us to have more entertainment and convenience, but also it really like stop us from being energetic and active. >> All right.

samples.question: So, can most people balance work and life in Vietnam?
samples.transcript: Okay, let me think. Well, I think for the older generation, no, but it is totally different for the younger generation which is the Gen Z because I have seen a lot of youngster or like the new brand new adults they called. Okay, they really good at balancing work. My cousin for example, she has a 9-to-f5 work and she need to do it very seriously but still she has a lot of time for her family. I remember vivly one time we had a family gathering. Yeah, she was totally busy and she could not even she did not even have any time for herself. samples.question: >> Have your shopping habits changed in recent years?

samples.question: So, the question today, please, here, could you please describe a person you admire?
samples.transcript: Okay. When you are ready, please start now. >> Yes, I am was born ready. >> Okay. there are many people that I could talk about. However, if I had to pick one, it would be my stunning mom. Well, I know her absolutely because she is the one who gave birth to me and I am feel so really thankful for her. and well she is had a warm-hearted with a beautiful smile and she is always kind with our neighborhoods. Well, I admire her for a variety of reasons. Firstly, when she was younger, she chose to stop working just to have time to take care of my family, especially me. And secondly, when I was a kid, she taught me to study even to the point where I did not need to go to some extra classes. And she also taught me about some social skill like cooking or communicating with each other. And well, I can vividly remember when I was younger, I have a serious argument with her and then she cried a lot because she thought she is not a good mom. after a few hours I felt so guilty and so I came to her and said sorry to her and then we hug each other and smile then I we love each other. So in the future, I will always love my mom and try hard to give her the things that she deserve and I will become a person like her. >> Fantastic. Thank you very much. Wow, your mom sounds like a lovely lady. Come on, B. Well done. Thank you. Well, we will move on to part three now, please. And we are going to continue talking about role models.
